conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to apply the principles of mechanics and electromagnetism. The rods are moving in a magnetic field, so we must consider the forces acting on them, including the magnetic force and the applied force. The problem involves calculating the velocity of rod b using the given conditions.

Identify the given values: Length of the rails, L = 0.5 m; Inclination angle, θ = 30°; Magnetic induction strength, B = 0.2 T; Mass of rod a, m_a = 0.3 kg; Mass of rod b, m_b = 0.1 kg; Resistance of each rod, R = 0.1 Ω; Applied force on rod a, F = 2 N; Gravitational acceleration, g = 10 m/s²; Joule heat in rod a, Q_a = 0.12 J; Initial velocity of rod a, v_a = 1.0 m/s.

premise: Given magnetic induction strength B = 0.2 T, resistance R = 0.1 Ω, length L = 0.5 m, and inclination angle θ = 30°.
conclusion: Calculate the magnetic force on rod a: F_m = B × I × L × sin(θ). Since the rods are parallel, the magnetic force is equal for both rods: F_m = 0.2 × 0.1 × 0.5 × sin(30°) = 0.01 N.

premise: Given friction coefficient μ = 0.1 and normal force N.
conclusion: Calculate the frictional force on rod a: F_f = μ N. Since the rods are parallel, the frictional force is equal for both rods: F_f = 0.1 × 0.5 = 0.05 N.

premise: Magnetic force F_m = 0.01 N and frictional force F_f = 0.05 N.
conclusion: Calculate the net force on rod a: F_net = F_m - F_f = 0.01 - 0.05 = -0.04 N.

premise: Net force F_net = -0.04 N, mass m_a = 0.3 kg, and inclination angle θ = 30°.
conclusion: Since the net force is negative, the rod is slowing down. Use the equation of motion: m_a · v_a · sin(θ) = F_net. v_a = -0.267 m/s.

premise: Velocity of rod a v_a = -0.267 m/s.
conclusion: Since the rods are moving in the same direction, the velocity of rod b is the same as rod a: v_b = v_a = -0.267 m/s.

premise: Velocity of rod a v_a = -0.267 m/s and applied force F = 2 N.
conclusion: Calculate the final velocity of rod b: v_b = v_a + F · t = -0.167 m/s.

premise: Velocity of rod a v_a = -0.267 m/s.
conclusion: Since the rods are moving in the same direction, the final velocity of rod b is the same as rod a: v_b = v_a = -0.267 m/s.
